result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary P Tipton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 8/1/15 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 8  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

--serve 90  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for treatment and medical appointments; to commence on   8/1/ 2015 at 8:00am

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary P Tipton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice--Final Notice

Huber/work release notification
TTP slip
With JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 1:07pm [mo]
Defendant Gary P Tipton in court with Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance
ADA Hall verifies that the State is prepared for Trial
Atty. Nagel indicates that Mr. Tipton will enter a plea today. 
recess:1:10pm--reconvene: 1:12pm (to allow Defense to complete plea paperwork)

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
ADA Hall submits Victim Impact Statement
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made by Mr. Tipton

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 90  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for treatment and medical appointments; to commence on   8/1/ 2015 at 8:00am
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 8/1/15 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 8  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 1:58pm
Court grants Attorney Nagels request to remove the 6/22/15 motion hearing
Letter from Attorney Nagel re scheduling
Motion hearing at 06-22-2015 10:00 am
Motion hearing at 06-22-2015 10:00 am
State's Notice of Audiovisual Recording of Child's Statements and Request for Hearing (908.08(2)(a), Wis. Stats.) (with attached DVD)
State's Notice of Motion and Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications
State's Notice of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant
Jury trial on July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 29, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Scheduling Order
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 9:31 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Gary P Tipton in court with Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified
Atty Nagel: Conveyed offer to Mr. Tipton, but do need further time for consideration. Requests additional STC in 30 - 60 days. 
Court informs parties that It will set matter for trial, presents basis including child witness
off-record for scheduling: 9:33  - 9:34 am 
Court announces date for the record; Clerk distributes scheduling order
Recess: 9:35 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule FSSC 6/29/15 at 1:00 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 7/2/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on May 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 22, 2015 at 02:20 pm.
State's with Cover Letter

Conflict review worksheet
Scheduling notice

[MK] case called at 2:29pm. 
Defendant Gary P Tipton in court with Attorney Robert F Nagel.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as an Assistant Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys in the DA's Office did prosecute Mr. Tipton in 1990 and 1991. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
The Defense stands mute. Plea of "not guilty" entered by the Court on the Defendant's behalf; speedy trial waived by the Defense 

The Court requires $ 1,000 signature bond, with conditions: 
--no presence at Tribeca in Watertown
--no contact with anyone under the age of 18
recess 2:35pm. 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/22/15 at 2:20pm  (2)  Status Conference on 5/12/15 at 9:30am
Defendants
Attorney Nagel
